definition: to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
journey/trip/expedition/to go on long campaign/to attack

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Caesar, William the Conquerer allopted for a full invasion of England.
sentences.chinese: 凯撒，威廉这样的征服者都选择完全的侵略英格兰。

sentences.english: and an aging Challenger-class diesel submarine, the Conqueror.
sentences.chinese: 和老化的挑战者级柴油潜艇“征服者”。

sentences.english: He enjoys highlighting the stories of the underdogs—be they the Welsh or the Estonians.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢关注被征服者的故事，如威尔士或爱沙尼亚。

sentences.english: Khan is one of the greatest conquerors who ever lived.
sentences.chinese: 成吉思汗是史上最伟大的征服者之一。

sentences.english: Conquerors sometimes talk of vanquishing and overcoming.
sentences.chinese: 征服者有时会提到战胜与超越。

sentences.english: The conquerors depopulated the enemy's country by destruction and expulsion.
sentences.chinese: 征服者用毁灭和驱逐的方法来减少敌国的人口。

sentences.english: The conqueror governed his new subjects with an iron scepter .
sentences.chinese: 征服者以铁腕统治其新臣民。

sentences.english: Fueling the Sith conquest was the Star Forge.
sentences.chinese: 为西斯征服者输血的就是“星际煅炉”。

sentences.english: In the field of religion, the Orientals succeeded in turning their conquerors into captives.
sentences.chinese: 在宗教领域，东方人使他们的征服者变成了被征服者。

sentences.english: In the field of religion, the Orientals succeeded in turning their conquerors into captives.
sentences.chinese: 在宗教领域，东方人使他们的征服者变成了被征服者。

sentences.english: Maybe Wenger is right and this side will grow into fearless conquerors.
sentences.chinese: 也许，温格是对的，他的球队终会长成无畏的征服者。

sentences.english: Timur was an even bloodier conqueror than Genghis had been.
sentences.chinese: 铁木尔是一位甚至比成吉思汗更为血腥的征服者。

sentences.english: Hitherto the greatness of a conqueror was geographical.
sentences.chinese: 而迄今，征服者的伟大都只限地缘。

sentences.english: He grovelled at the feet of conqueror.
Windsor Castle has been a royal residence since the time of William the Conqueror. Population, 28, 700.
sentences.chinese: 温莎堡自从征服者威廉时期以来一直是王室住所。

sentences.english: The people of the conquered country and the conquerers would both benefit.
sentences.chinese: 被征服国家的人民和征服者会同时受益。

definition: (loanword) caliph/also written 哈利發|哈利发[ha1 li4 fa1]

pinyin: Ya4 li4 shan1 da4 Da4 di4

definition: Cyrus the Great (ca. 600-530 BC), the founder of the Persian Empire and the conqueror of Babylon
